bug.author: ndufresne
bug.summary: Do not make important calls inside g_assert()
bug.description:
Hi there, this is a quick recommendation to improve your code quality. First thing that struck me when I inspected this is code is this type of usage: <denchmark-code>g_assert (gst_buffer_map (srcbuf, &src_info, GST_MAP_READ)); </denchmark-code>
It is common on embedded devices to compile out run-time checks. It's actually a GLib feature. If you construct your code the way you do, the call to gst_buffer_map() will be removed, and your code will crash badly. It is also usually recommended to cleanly handle map failure.

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/2282>#2282</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.
Thank you for pointing it out! And I agree that map-errors should be handled property without assert.
